confabulation noun [U or C]
(CONVERSATION)
Add to word list
Add to word list
formal or humorous conversation or discussion about something: They were seen in close confabulation over a drink. Work involved endless meetings, confabulations, and discussions about the law.
More examplesFewer examplesI could hear much confabulation coming from the dining room.The results of this month of confabulations are fairly predictable.In the kitchens Mrs Clark and the school cook were having one of their morning confabulations.

confabulation noun [U or C]
(FALSE MEMORIES)
medical
  specialized a problem that makes someone produce false memories about events, or the false memories themselves: Confabulation differs from lying in that the person is not consciously attempting to deceive. Confabulations are artificial constructions of our own design built round particles of retained experience.
More examplesFewer examplesHis mangled words are a demonstration of what physicians call confabulation. Confabulation is the use of imaginary experiences or made-up information to fill missing gaps of memory. Korsakoff syndrome consists of confabulation, confusion, and recent memory loss.

confabulation noun [U or C]
(FALSE INFORMATION)
[ C or U ] the fact of an artificial intelligence (= a computer system that has some of the qualities that the human brain has, such as the ability to produce language in a way that seems human) producing false information: We tried to fine-tune the model to reduce confabulation. Synonym
hallucination (COMPUTERS)
[ C ] false information that is produced by an artificial intelligence (= a computer system that has some of the qualities that the human brain has, such as the ability to produce language in a way that seems human): It's important to consider confabulations, or hallucinations, in AI-generated responses, which may lead to the creation of inaccurate information.
